sourcing.instructions: B: Purchase from chemical supply stores or online. La: Obtain from a rare earth metal supplier. Sn: Available from hardware stores or metal suppliers. Tc: Source from specialized radioactive material suppliers (ensure proper licenses are held).
steps: B: Purchase from chemical supply stores or online. La: Obtain from a rare earth metal supplier. Sn: Available from hardware stores or metal suppliers. Tc: Source from specialized radioactive material suppliers (ensure proper licenses are held).

1. Weigh out 180 g of B, 120 g of La, 30 g of Sn, and 60 g of Tc using an analytical balance. 2. In a dry, clean environment, combine the B, La, Sn, and Tc in a high-purity ceramic crucible. 3. Mix the powders thoroughly using a spatula or mechanical mixer for 10 minutes to ensure homogeneity.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out 180 g of B, 120 g of La, 30 g of Sn, and 60 g of Tc using an analytical balance. 2. In a dry, clean environment, combine the B, La, Sn, and Tc in a high-purity ceramic crucible. 3. Mix the powders thoroughly using a spatula or mechanical mixer for 10 minutes to ensure homogeneity.

steps: 1. Preheat a high-temperature furnace to 1000째C. 2. Place the crucible with the mixed powders into the furnace. 3. Hold at 1000째C for 4 hours to allow for complete melting and alloying of the materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a high-temperature furnace to 1000째C. 2. Place the crucible with the mixed powders into the furnace. 3. Hold at 1000째C for 4 hours to allow for complete melting and alloying of the materials.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 2-3 hours). 2. Ensure that the crucible remains in the furnace during the cooling process to avoid thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 2-3 hours). 2. Ensure that the crucible remains in the furnace during the cooling process to avoid thermal shock.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the crucible and carefully extract the solidified alloy. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the material into the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges to remove any sharpness and achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant suitable for metals to enhance durability.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the crucible and carefully extract the solidified alloy. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the material into the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges to remove any sharpness and achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant suitable for metals to enhance durability.
